turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: That noise don't come from no ordinary bird.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It may be just a cricket Or a critter in the trees.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: As Monarch of the Forest I don't like the situation.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Are you gonna stand around And let 'em fill us full of horror?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I'd like to roar 'em down -- But I think I lost my roarer.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- Oh -- Oh!  Toto -- Toto!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Did they hurtcha?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Lion, darling -- I knew you'd come!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: They're coming back!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ohhh!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: ...Ain't it the truth!  Ain't it the truth!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- oh -- they're all wonderful.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, now I'll never get home!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Stay with us, then, Dorothy.  We all love you.  We don't want you to go.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, that's very kind of you -- but this could never be like Kansas.  Auntie Em must have stopped wondering what happened to me by now.  Oh, Scarecrow, what am I going to do?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Well -- I would never've found it if it hadn't been for you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I think I'll miss you most of all.

turns.speaker: HUNK
turns.text: Now lookit, Dorothy, you ain't using your head about Miss Gulch.  Think you didn't have any brains at all.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I have so got brains.

turns.speaker: HUNK
turns.text: Well, why don't you use them?  When you come home, don't go by Miss Gulch's place.  Then Toto won't get in her garden, and you won't get in no trouble.  See?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, Hunk, you just won't listen, that's all.

turns.speaker: HUNK
turns.text: Well, your head ain't made of straw, you know.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why, Zeke, -- you're just as scared as I am!

turns.speaker: HUNK
turns.text: What's the matter -- gonna let a little old pig make a coward out of you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...don't talk.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: It's pleasant down that way, too.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Down?  No, you see, I'm -- Well, -- I'm --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, well, here -- let me help you.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, that's very kind of you -- very kind.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...yes.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Ohhhh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Whhhooops!  Ha-ha -- there goes some of me again!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- does it hurt you?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, no -- I just keep picking it up and putting it back in again.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ohhh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: My, it's good to be....

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: ...free!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!  Oh!  Ohhh!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Did I scare you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No, No -- I -- I just thought you hurt yourself.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Wonderful!  Why, if our Scarecrow back in Kansas could do that, the crows'd be scared to pieces!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: They would?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Um-hmm.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Where's Kansas?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That's where I live.  And I want to get back there so badly I'm going all the way to Emerald City to get the Wizard of Oz to help me.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: You're going to see a Wizard?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Um-hmm.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Do you think if I went with you this Wizard would give me some brains?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I couldn't say.  But even if he didn't, you'd be no worse off than you are now.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Yes -- that's true.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But maybe you'd better not.  I've got a witch mad at me, and you might get into trouble.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Witch?  Huh!  I'm not afraid of a witch! I'm not afraid of anything --- except a lighted match.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't blame you for that.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: But I'd face a whole box full of them for the chance of getting some brains.  Look -- I won't be any trouble, because I don't eat a thing -- and I won't try to manage things, because I can't think.  Won't you take me with you?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Hooray!  We're off to see a Wizard!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- well -- you're not starting out very well.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, I'll try!  Really, I will.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: To Oz?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: To Oz!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, dear -- I keep forgetting I'm not in Kansas.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Come along, Dorothy -- you don't want any of those apples.  Hmm!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Hooray!  I guess that did it!  Help yourself.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why, it's a man!  A man made out of tin!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes.  Oh -- look --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oil can what?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oil can?  Oh -- oh, here it is!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: He said his mouth.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Here -- here --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: The other side....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes --- there.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: But you've just been saying how much you want a heart.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And I'll keep the oil-can handy.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: ...just that the Witch is so wicked. I don't think you two ought to come with me because you'll get into trouble.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, you don't think we're going to stand by and let her get away with fireballs and bees, do you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, you're the best friends anybody ever had!  And it's funny, but I feel as if I've known you all the time.  But I couldn't have, could I?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: I don't see how.  You weren't around when I was stuffed and sewn together, were you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't like this forest!  It's -- it's dark and creepy!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Of course, I don't know, but I think it'll get darker before it gets lighter.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Do -- do you suppose we'll meet any wild animals?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, that's too bad.  Don't you think the Wizard could help him, too?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't see why not.  Why don't you come along with us?  We're on our way to see the Wizard now. To get him a heart.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: ...along.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, no -- please.  I have to rest for just a minute.  Toto!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: It does help.  Dorothy, you're waking up!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Yes -- there --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- here quick -- oh! - we'll oil him up.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: -- A hot water bottle would be good if we had one.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, he's been crying! Why have you been --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Dear, whatever shall we do?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Well, we'd better hurry if we're going to see the Wizard!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Looks like we came a long way for nothing.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- and I was so happy!  I thought I was on my way home!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh -- Oh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh -- are you -- are you all right?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, come on now - everybody --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Did you just hear what I just heard?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: No -- No -- No -- No!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Ohh!  OHH!  OHH!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Help! I'm burning!  I'm burning!  I'm burning!  Help! Help! Help!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Who killed my sister?  Who killed the Witch of the East? Was it you? Answer me!

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Leave her alone!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: You stay out of this! I'm here for vengeance! So it was you, was it? You killed her,....

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: ...ting the ruby slippers?

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: The slippers -- yes.....the slippers!

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: The ruby slippers!  What have you done with them? Give them back to me, or I'll ---

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: It's too late!  There they....

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: You stay out of this, Glinda, or I'll fix you as well!

turns.speaker: GLINDA
turns.text: Oh, rubbish!  You have no power here. Be gone, before somebody drops a house on you, too.

turns.speaker: WITCH
turns.text: Very well -- I'll bide my time -- and as for you, my fine lady, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way....

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Real courage. That's what we want.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: You do? boys, you're aiming low. You not only surprise, but you grieve me.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Ah --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Dorothy next!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Yes. Dorothy -- ah -- Dor --

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: ...excellence to the Miracle Wonderland Carnival Company -- until one day, while performing spectacular feats of stratospheric skill never before attempted by civilized man, an unfortunate phenomena occurred. The balloon failed to return to the fair.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: It did?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Comin' to think of it, forty winks wouldn't be bad.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Don't you start it, too!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What if it were a brontosaurus?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I'd show him who was King of the Fores'!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Would...would it do any good if I roared?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Who at?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Wait a minute, fellahs.  I was just thinkin'.  I really don't want to see the Wizard this much.  I better wait for you outside.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Somebody pulled my tail.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, you did it yourself!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I -- Oh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Here --   Come on.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: They sure knocked the stuffings out of you, didn't they?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Don't stand there talking!  Put me together! We've got to find Dorothy!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: I've got a plan how to get in there.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Fine.  He's got a plan

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: And you're going to lead us.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeah. Me?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Yes, you.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I -- I -- I -- I -- gotta get her outta there?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: All right, I'll go in there for Dorothy -- Wicked Witch or no Wicked Witch -- guards or no guards -- I'll tear 'em apart.  I may not come out alive, but I'm going in there.  There's only one thing I want you fellows to do.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Up!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Now...

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Come on -- I've got another idea.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Do -- do you think it'll be polite -- dropping in like this?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Stop pushing!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Oh - I was only trying to help. Ohhh!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Where -- where do we go now?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: This way!  Come on!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: You humbug!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Sneaking up on me, eh?  Why!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Here -- here. Go 'way and let us alone!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Oh, scared, huh?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: I haven't slept in weeks.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Why don't you try counting sheep?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: That doesn't do any good -- I'm afraid of 'em.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Dorothy!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Dorothy! You can't sleep here! You can't sleep in the middle of a field!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Not even a rhinoceros?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Imposserous!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: From now on, we're on enemy ground. You should have something to protect yourself with.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: She - she can have my Witch Remover.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: What's that? What's that? Take it away - take it away - Take it away!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Hold still - hold still --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: It's a whatzis.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: It's a whatzis?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Whozat?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Whozat?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Now, let' s see -- this goes -- Oh, I wish I were better at puzzles.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Wait a minute. This is the left one. He walks bad enough already.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh, poor Dorothy. We may never see her again.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: There. Now, that's the best we can do without any pins.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: ...I -- I -- I hope my strength holds out.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I hope your tail holds out. Oh --

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: No?  Now, wait a minute.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: You don't neither --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Where do we go now?

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: ...the door! Open the door! Open the door! Open the door! Open the door!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Don't push!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: You don't get around us that easy!

turns.speaker: LION
turns.text: Not nohow!

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: Mr. Gale!

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Howdy, Miss Gulch.

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: I want to see you and your wife right away....

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: ... about Dorothy.

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Dorothy?  Well, what has Dorothy done?

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: What's she done?  I'm all but lame from the bite on my leg!

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: You mean she bit you?

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: No, her dog!

turns.speaker: UNCLE HENRY
turns.text: Oh, she bit her dog, eh?

turns.speaker: MISS GULCH
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ...Tin Man!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ohhhh -- it's me!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ...junk!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ohhhh -- yes...yes, sir -- Y-Yes, your Honor.  You see, a while back, we were walking down the Yellow Brick Road, and --

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: Quiet!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ohhhhhh!

turns.speaker: OZ'S VOICE
turns.text: ...of the West.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: B-B-B-B-B-But if we do that, we'll have to kill her to get it!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Beautiful!  What an echo!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: It's empty. The tinsmith forgot to give me a heart.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: I'm not afraid of her.  I'll see you get safely to the Wizard now, whether I get a brain or not!  Stuff a mattress with me! Hah!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I'll see you reach the Wizard, whether I get a heart of not.  Bee-hive -- bah!  Let her try and make a bee-hive out of me! You know -- Hmm? What's that?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: No, sir!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: We do.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: To Oz?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: To Oz!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Animals that -- that eat straw?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Some -- but mostly lions, and tigers, and bears.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I'd be gentle as a lizard --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: I'd be clever as a gizzard --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Then I'm sure to get a brain --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: A heart --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Come on -- come on --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Hurry -- hurry --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh!  Oh, come on, come on!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Look -- you can see it here.  It's wonderful!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Emerald City!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Hey, Dorothy!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Dorothy!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh - oh, poor Dorothy!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Don't cry -- you'll rust yourself again!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh!  We ought to try and carry Dorothy.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: I don't think I could, but we could try.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Let's.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh -- now look at him!  This is terrible!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Here, Tin Man -- help me.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, this is terrible -- can't budge her an inch!  This is a spell, this is!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: It's the Wicked Witch!  What'll we do? Help!  HELP!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: It's no use screaming at a time like this! Nobody will hear you!  Help!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Ha -- ha -- ha --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Ho -- ho --ho

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Did you hear that?  He'll announce us at once!  I've as good as got my brain!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I can fairly hear my heart beating!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, did - did you see that?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh - look out.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: You know something?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, I think I see a jijik And he's fuzzy and he's furry I haven't got a brain But I think I ought to worry!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I haven't got a heart But I got a palpitation.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: It's a whozis.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: It's a whozis?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Help! Help! Help! Help! Help!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh!  Well, what happened to you?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: They tore my legs off, and they threw them over there! Then they took my chest out, and they threw it over there!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Well, that's you all over.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Who do you suppose they were? And where did they take her? A fine thing - to go to pieces at a time like this!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Now, now, don't fret.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, dear, dear.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: We'll get you together!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, don't worry about me. I'm all right. We must worry about Dorothy.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: But how can we find her? We don't even know where she is. Look! There's....

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: ...to Dorothy!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Come on, fellows!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh, I hate to think of her in there.  We've got to get her out.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Don't cry now.  We haven't got the oil-can with us and you've been squeaking enough as it is.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: No, you don't.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh, no!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Whew! That wasn't my plan - but something happened, didn't it?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: You put up a great fight, Lion.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: I don't know what we'd have done without you.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Oh - upstairs, quickly!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Go on!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Hey -- what about Dorothy?

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Yes -- how about Dorothy?
